intro: Matelea brevistipitata, commonly known as the short-stemmed matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. Matelea brevistipitata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
